p: Only a century ago, the 1918 influenza pandemic killed 50 million or more people, apparently the deadliest event in recorded human history ( Morens and Taubenberger, 2020). The HIV/AIDS pandemic, recognized in 1981, has so far killed at least 37 million. And the past decade has witnessed unprecedented pandemic explosions: H1N1 “swine” influenza (2009), chikungunya (2014), and Zika (2015), as well as pandemic-like emergences of Ebola fever over large parts of Africa (2014 to the present).
